snippet: Gordon Raymond has sold drugs and spent time in prison, but he is determined to resist a return to the streets and instead earn a degree in social work.
abstract: Federation of Protestant Welfare Agencies, one of the seven agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, provides money to Gordon Raymond to buy furniture for his apartment as he seeks to recover from criminal past and pursue a future in social work.
lead_paragraph: Gordon Raymond has sold drugs and spent time in prison, but he is determined to resist a return to the streets and instead earn a degree in social work.

headline.print_headline: Rejecting a Life of Crime to Help Others
headline.main: Rejecting a Life of Crime, and Hoping to Help Others

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
